intro: Trichogonia harleyi, commonly known as the desert broom. It is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant features a low-growing, sprawling habit with gray-green, scale-like leaves that help reduce water loss. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Trichogonia harleyi is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its specialized morphology and efficient water conservation strategies.
